---
title: Generate content programmatically
---

With the chunk option `results = 'asis'`, you can
write out text as raw Markdown content, which can
also be mixed with plots.

```{r setup}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(magick)

```


```{r, fonksiyon}
add_logo <- function(path, options) {
  img <- magick::image_read(path)
  # the R logo
  logo <- file.path("C:/Users/LENOVO/Desktop/GK - HIA Uygulama/www/tuik.png")
  logo <- magick::image_read(logo)
  # the default gravity is northwest, and users can change
  # it via the chunk option magick.gravity
  if (is.null(g <- options$magick.gravity)) 
    g <- "northwest"
  # add the logo to the plot
  img <- magick::image_composite(img, logo, gravity = g)
  # write out the new image
  magick::image_write(img, path)
  path
}
```
